Questions 1

Calculate the mass of oxygen in 10 moles of water (H₂O). The molar mass of oxygen is 16 g/mol. {1:NUMERICAL:=160:0}

Question 2

What is the chemical symbol for oxygen?

{1:SHORTANSWER:%100%O}

Question 3

To which group does oxygen belong in the periodic table?

{1:MULTICHOICE:%-33.33333%Alkali metals~=Chalcogens~%-33.33333%Noble gases~%-33.33333%Halogens}

Question 4

{1:MULTIRESPONSE:=Sulfur dioxide~%-50%Methane~=Carbon dioxide~=Water}

generalfeedback.text:
• The mass of oxygen is calculated by multiplying the number of moles by the molar mass of oxygen. For 10 moles of water, it is 10 * 16 = 160 g.
  • The chemical symbol for oxygen is ‘O’.
  • False / True / False / False
  • CH4 / SO2 / CO2 / H2O
